quoteFirst: Through the open window of the kitchen, came the staccato firing of a motor exhaust. Without looking at the clock on the shelf, the girl knew it was exactly
quoteLast: . Also and without looking toward the railroad, she knew that her father, Robert Buckley, had shut down the gas engine that pumped water into the big red tank. He was hauling out the “speeder” to make his regular evening run over the line to place the lamps in the block signals.
title: The girl at Silver Thistle
author: Hale, Max

quoteFirst: His movements at this critical moment were marked by great indecision. His first idea appears to have been to land an armed force for the protection of the Europeans, for at
quoteLast: the _Helicon_ made the general signal to the fleet, "Prepare to land armed boats." This order, however, was annulled five minutes later. The captains of the English men-of-war were then signalled to assemble on board the Flag-ship, when, after consultation, it was decided, as the only course open, to send boats round to the Eastern Harbour under cover of the guns of H.M.S.
title: The Egyptian campaigns, 1882 to 1885
author: Royle, Charles, 1882-1936

quoteFirst: The testimony of Pauline Virginia Bates was taken at
quoteLast: , on March 25, 1964, in the office of the U.S. attorney, 301 Post Office Building, Bryan and Ervay Streets, Dallas, Tex., by Mr. Albert E.
title: Warren Commission (08 of 26): Hearings Vol. VIII (of 15)
author: United States. Warren Commission

quoteFirst: I tied a message to her feet giving my name and nautical position. She first tacked a bit to starboard, and then took a crow’s course to land. At
quoteLast: she came back with muddy feet and an olive branch in her mouth. Hurrah! the waters are evaporating from off the face of the earth.
title: The Log of the Ark, by Noah; Hieroglypics by Ham
author: Gordon, Irwin Leslie, 1888-1954; Frueh, Alfred Joseph, 1880-1968 [Illustrator]
